intro: Silene undulifolia, commonly known as the wavyleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and clusters of small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant's leaves are wavy-edged and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Silene undulifolia thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, known for its showy flowers and unique adaptations to harsh environments.
